original_solution_mapping.L1: Since Jack was faster than Jill, his total running time must have been 32 - 7 = <<32-7=25>>25 seconds.
original_solution_mapping.L2: Subtracting the the time he spent running up the first half of the hill shows that it took 25 - 19 = <<25-19=6>>6 seconds to run up the second half of the hill.

original_function_code:
def solve():
    """Index: 7117.
    Returns: the time it took Jack to run up the second half of the hill.
    """
    # L1
    jill_total_time = 32 # Jill finished the race in 32 seconds
    jack_time_before_jill = 7 # 7 seconds before Jill did
    jack_total_time = jill_total_time - jack_time_before_jill

    # L2
    jack_first_half_time = 19 # Jack ran up the first half of the hill in 19 seconds
    jack_second_half_time = jack_total_time - jack_first_half_time

    # FA
    answer = jack_second_half_time
    return answer

logical_steps.solution_line_template: Since Jack was faster than Jill, his total running time must have been {jill_total_time} - {jack_time_before_jill} = <<{jill_total_time}-{jack_time_before_jill}={jack_total_time}>>{jack_total_time} seconds.

Subtracting the the time he spent running up the first half of the hill shows that it took {jack_total_time} - {jack_first_half_time} = <<{jack_total_time}-{jack_first_half_time}={jack_second_half_time}>>{jack_second_half_time} seconds to run up the second half of the hill.

flawed_nl_reconstruction.L1: Since Jack was faster than Jill, his total running time must have been 32 - 7 = <<32-7=25>>25 seconds.
flawed_nl_reconstruction.L2: Subtracting the the time he spent running up the first half of the hill shows that it took 32 - 19 = <<32-19=13>>13 seconds to run up the second half of the hill.

explanation: Incorrect operand. The variable 'jill_total_time' (value: 32) was used instead of 'jack_total_time' (value: 25).
